radiographic_examinations.findings: The echotexture of the liver is heterogeneous and coarsened. The portal vein is patent. There is no intra or extrahepatic biliary dilatation. The common bile duct measures 5 mm. The gallbladder is filled with multiple stones and has a thickened wall; however, it does not appear distended and there is no pericholecystic fluid. A stone is present in the gallbladder neck. There is a possible positive sonographic sign. The visualized portions of the pancreas are unremarkable. The visualized aorta and IVC are unremarkable. There is no free fluid within the abdomen.
